headline: Bank earnings, retail sales, SCOTUS tariff ruling: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime Host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Wednesday, January 14, including earnings results from major banks Citigroup (C), Wells Fargo (WFC), and Bank of America (BAC); the latest print on US retail sales data from November; and the US Supreme Court's (SCOTUS) expected ruling on President Trump's tariff policies. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Is It Time To Reconsider Citigroup (C) After Its Strong Multi Year Share Price Run?
summary: If you are wondering whether Citigroup’s current share price reflects its true worth, you are not alone. This article is built to help you make sense of what you are paying for each US$ you put into the stock. Citigroup shares last closed at US$116.30, after a 5.1% decline over the past week, a 4.0% gain over the past month, and returns of 62.6% over 1 year, 157.8% over 3 years, and 118.3% over 5 years that may have changed how investors think about both its potential and its risks. These...

headline: JPMorgan Stock Rises After Sharp Drop on Earnings. What Spooked Markets.
summary: JPMorgan Chase  stock was showing signs of recovery in Wednesday’s premarket following a sharp fall the previous session on disappointing fourth-quarter results.  While the bank’s adjusted earnings beat analysts’ estimates, profits fell 7% from a year earlier on the back of lower-than-expected investment banking fees.  The banking giant had to set up a $2.2 billion credit reserve as part of agreeing to buy the iPhone maker’s card portfolio.

content.title: JPMorgan Stock Rises After Sharp Drop on Earnings. What Spooked Markets.
content.summary: JPMorgan Chase  stock was showing signs of recovery in Wednesday’s premarket following a sharp fall the previous session on disappointing fourth-quarter results.  While the bank’s adjusted earnings beat analysts’ estimates, profits fell 7% from a year earlier on the back of lower-than-expected investment banking fees.  The banking giant had to set up a $2.2 billion credit reserve as part of agreeing to buy the iPhone maker’s card portfolio.

headline: Bank earnings: What else to expect as JPMorgan comes under pressure
summary: While JPMorgan Chase (JPM) kicks off earnings season for Big Banks this week, HSBC Head of US Financials Research Saul Martinez talks about his earnings forecast for other banking institutions this week. Also watch Saul Martinez discuss JPMorgan's latest earnings release and what President Trump's proposed 10% cap on credit card rates could mean for credit lenders. headline: Stock Index Futures Slip With Focus on U.S. Retail Sales and PPI Data, More Big Bank Earnings on Tap

headline: Bank earnings, commodities gains, retail sales & PPI: 3 Things
summary: Big Bank stocks Wells Fargo (WFC), Citigroup (C), and Bank of America (BAC) released their fourth quarter earnings results this morning. US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) fall in Wednesday's pre-market trading, while oil prices (CL=F, BZ=F) continue to tick back up and gold (GC=F) and silver (SI=F) climb to new record highs. US retail sales topped expectations for November, while December's Producer Price Index (PPI) inflation reading came out hotter than expected. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Financial Stocks Have Had a Wild Week. Citi and 9 More That Look Promising.
summary: Between a Truth Social post from President Donald Trump and fourth-quarter earnings, financial stocks have had a crazy week.  The first reason is that Trump posted that he wants to cap interest rates on credit cards at 10% for a year, which would slash rates roughly in half and devastate earnings for card issuers.  JPMorgan Chase  stock fell Monday in response to its results, while  Bank of America Citi  group, and  Wells Fargo  all lost ground after reporting on Tuesday.

content.title: Financial Stocks Have Had a Wild Week. Citi and 9 More That Look Promising.
content.summary: Between a Truth Social post from President Donald Trump and fourth-quarter earnings, financial stocks have had a crazy week. JPMorgan Chase  stock fell Monday in response to its results, while  Bank of America Citi  group, and  Wells Fargo  all lost ground after reporting on Tuesday.

headline: Wall Street’s Mixed Investment Banking Hauls Fail to Wow Investors
summary: Big banks have so far reported mixed fourth quarter-earnings for their investment banking businesses, even as the IPO market recorded a banner year in 2025.  Citi said investment banking fees rose 35% to $1.29 billion.  The bank has been on a quest to improve its investment banking performance under CEO Jane Fraser.

content.title: Wall Street’s Mixed Investment Banking Hauls Fail to Wow Investors

headline: Citigroup’s Profit Drops on Russia Sale; Stock Skids
summary: Citigroup's profit dropped last quarter after the bank took a $1.2 billion loss selling its operations in Russia. Shares dropped more than 4%.    Profit fell 13% to $2.47 billion, or $1.19 per share. Analysts polled by FactSet had expected $1.

content.title: Citigroup’s Profit Drops on Russia Sale; Stock Skids
content.summary: Citigroup's profit dropped last quarter after the bank took a $1.2 billion loss selling its operations in Russia. Shares dropped more than 4%.    Profit fell 13% to $2.47 billion, or $1.19 per share. Analysts polled by FactSet had expected $1.

headline: Stock Market Today: Dow Improves Slightly While AppLovin Makes Giant Move (Live Coverage)
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average and the other major stock indexes trimmed larger losses Wednesday afternoon as Wall Street remained skittish over new inflation data.  Among the losers was Nvidia as well as a number of banks after their earnings results.  Meanwhile, AppLovin sank on the stock market today.

headline: Bank sell-off is more about valuation than earnings performances
summary: Bank stocks slid lower in Wednesday's session after Wells Fargo (WFC), Citigroup (C), Bank of America (BAC), and JPMorgan Chase (JPM) reported their latest earnings results this week. Morgan Stanley (MS) and Goldman Sachs (GS) also tick lower ahead of their earnings releases due out on Thursday. S&P Global Market Intelligence director of financial institutions research Nathan Stovall addresses the valuation concerns tied to the banking sector that may be dragging the financial sector down despite generally strong results. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

content.title: Bank sell-off is more about valuation than earnings performances
content.description:
Bank stocks slid lower in Wednesday's session after Wells Fargo (WFC), Citigroup (C), Bank of America (BAC), and JPMorgan Chase (JPM) reported their latest earnings results this week. Morgan Stanley (MS) and Goldman Sachs (GS) also tick lower ahead of their earnings releases due out on Thursday.

S&P Global Market Intelligence director of financial institutions research Nathan Stovall addresses the valuation concerns tied to the banking sector that may be dragging the financial sector down despite generally strong results.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser warns of job cuts and says it’s time to raise the bar in a fiery memo to staff: ‘We are not graded on effort’
summary: Fortune's Most Powerful Woman on Wall Street is cutting 1,000 jobs now, with tens of thousands more to come as she says "old, bad habits" are over.

content.summary: Fortune's Most Powerful Woman on Wall Street is cutting 1,000 jobs now, with tens of thousands more to come as she says "old, bad habits" are over.
